p: KIF20A, is a microtubule-associated motor protein localized to the Golgi apparatus that is required for cell cycle mitosis [ 47]. Until now, KIF20A has been reported to be a key gene in the progression of many tumors, such as prostate cancer, colorectal cancer, gastric cancer, et al. [ 48– 50]. Recently, KIF20A has also been proved to promote the invasion and metastasis of EOC, and could be seen as a valuable chemoresistance and prognostic biomarker for EOC patients [ 51– 53].
